trans-unit.source: Scores predictions for a trained classification or regression model
trans-unit.target: Scores predictions for a trained classification or regression model

trans-unit.source: You can use <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token> to generate predictions using a trained classification or regression model.
trans-unit.target: You can use <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token> to generate predictions using a trained classification or regression model.

trans-unit.source: The predicted value can be in many different formats, depending on the model and your input data:
trans-unit.target: The predicted value can be in many different formats, depending on the model and your input data:

trans-unit.source: If you are using a classification model to create the scores, <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token> outputs a predicted value for the class, as well as the probability of the predicted value.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a classification model to create the scores, <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token> outputs a predicted value for the class, as well as the probability of the predicted value.

trans-unit.source: For regression models, <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token> generates just the predicted numeric value.
trans-unit.target: For regression models, <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token> generates just the predicted numeric value.

trans-unit.source: For image classification models, the score might be the class of object in the image, or a Boolean indicating whether a particular feature was found.
trans-unit.target: For image classification models, the score might be the class of object in the image, or a Boolean indicating whether a particular feature was found.

trans-unit.source: After you have generated a set of scores using <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token>, you can connect the scored dataset to <token>M_EvaluateGeneric</token>, to generate a set of metrics used for evaluating the model’s accuracy (performance).
trans-unit.target: After you have generated a set of scores using <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token>, you can connect the scored dataset to <token>M_EvaluateGeneric</token>, to generate a set of metrics used for evaluating the model’s accuracy (performance).

trans-unit.source: You can also save the results to a dataset, or use the output as part of a predictive web service.
trans-unit.target: You can also save the results to a dataset, or use the output as part of a predictive web service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>this tutorial</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-walkthrough-5-publish-web-service/</linkUri></externalLink> on publishing a web service using Azure ML Studio.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>this tutorial</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-walkthrough-5-publish-web-service/</linkUri></externalLink> on publishing a web service using Azure ML Studio.

trans-unit.source: If you are using one of the following special types of model, you might need to use one of these custom scoring modules:
trans-unit.target: If you are using one of the following special types of model, you might need to use one of these custom scoring modules:

trans-unit.source: Score a clustering model – <link xlink:href="eed3ee76-e8aa-46e6-907c-9ca767f5c114" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Assign to Clusters</link>
trans-unit.target: Score a clustering model – <link xlink:href="eed3ee76-e8aa-46e6-907c-9ca767f5c114" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Assign to Clusters</link>

trans-unit.source: Create recommendations or generate data for evaluating a recommender - <link xlink:href="55544522-9a10-44bd-884f-9a91a9cec2cd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score REcommender</link>
trans-unit.target: Create recommendations or generate data for evaluating a recommender - <link xlink:href="55544522-9a10-44bd-884f-9a91a9cec2cd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score REcommender</link>

trans-unit.source: For examples of how <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token> is used in an experimental workflow, see these examples in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/machine-learning/models/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token> is used in an experimental workflow, see these examples in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/machine-learning/models/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: If the data that you are scoring contains missing values, in many cases no score will be generated for the entire row.
trans-unit.target: If the data that you are scoring contains missing values, in many cases no score will be generated for the entire row.

trans-unit.source: The following machine learning models require that data have no missing values.
trans-unit.target: The following machine learning models require that data have no missing values.

trans-unit.source: When using the following machine learning models, review the data before passing it to <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token>, and use <link xlink:href="d2c5ca2f-7323-41a3-9b7e-da917c99f0c4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Clean Missing Data</link> to amend the missing values in input columns.
trans-unit.target: When using the following machine learning models, review the data before passing it to <token>M_ScoreGeneric</token>, and use <link xlink:href="d2c5ca2f-7323-41a3-9b7e-da917c99f0c4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Clean Missing Data</link> to amend the missing values in input columns.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if argument is not a number.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if argument is not a number.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if argument is Infinity.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if argument is Infinity.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if the learner that is passed to the module is an invalid type.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if the learner that is passed to the module is an invalid type.
